Authors:
Tanay Bose, Joseph Michael Hulbert, Trudy Paap, Treena I
Burgess, Michael J Wingfield
Title:
Two new endemic Phytophthora species from the Cape Floristic
Region of South Africa
Keywords:
Eastern Cape, Fynbos biome, Internal Transcribed Spacer
Region, natural forest, Western Cape
Abstract:
Cape Floristic Region spanning across Western and Eastern
Cape provinces of South Africa houses one of the highest endemic floral
diversity. These endemic and native plant species are being threatened
by both native and introduced Phytophthora species. Through the Cape
Citizen Science Programme, several surveys were conducted between
2014-2019 to catalogue the diversity of Phytophthora species associated
with this region. During the baiting of the soil samples collected
during these surveys, we recovered several already described species
along with six isolates of Phytophthora sp. emzansi and three isolates
of another Phytophthora species which morphologically resembled ITS
Clade 10 taxa. In the present study, we conducted multi-gene
phylogenetic analyses using complete Internal Transcribed Spacer along
with partial cytochrome oxidase I, B-tubulin and heat shock protein 90
coupled microscopic investigation to revised the taxonomy of P. sp.
emzansi and describe our newly recovered Phytophthora species. As
predicted previously P. sp. emzansi for a monophyletic lineage with the
ITS Clade 2 species and sister taxon to P. capensis. Our newly
recovered Phytophthora species forms an independent lineage within the
ITS Clade 10b species and phylogenetically close to P.
intercalaris and P. gallica.
